bwwExcerpt: Lane embodies the tomfoolery and vague melancholy of Shakespeare's best fools, equally adept at milking crude sight gags and waxing philosophical. Nielsen's antic ability to wring every laugh from with slightest tick has rarely met a more fruitful context. Julie White completes the funerary tea party as a midwife who crawls from the corporal heap having survived a slit to her throat. Under the direction of George C.
